TaxonIdentification.species_authority: F. Z. Li & S. J. Fan

TaxonIdentification.species_name: 青岛薹草 qing dao tai cao

treatment.description: Rhizome thick, obliquely ascending. Culms 30–40 cm tall, slender, trigonous, clothed at base with dark brown sheaths disintegrating into parallel fibers. Leaves longer than culm, blades linear, 3–5 mm wide, leathery. Involucral bracts shortly bladed, shorter than subtending spike, sheathing 2.5–4 cm. Spikes 2 or 3; terminal spike male, cylindric, ca. 40 × 7 mm; lateral spikes female, with few male flowers at apex, distant, cylindric, 4–5 × ca. 0.8 cm, densely flowered; peduncles 3–5 cm. Female glumes brown, elliptic-lanceolate, 8–10 mm, 3-veined costa excurrent into a scabrous awn ca. 5 mm, apex truncate or emarginate. Utricles obovate-elliptic, trigonous, 5–6 mm, glabrous, faces concave at base, apex abruptly contracted into a scabrous beak ca. 3 mm, orifice deeply 2-lobed. Nutlets obovate, trigonous, 2–2.5 mm, faces concave at base; style slender, base curved; stigmas 3.
